attributes.action: Offset the cost of petrol duty by using money that would have been spent on Syria
attributes.additional_details: With further unrest in Syria and the wider Middle East, petrol prices are on the rise again, I would like to propose that cost of any military action against the Syrian government is actually used to lower the price of petrol. Not that I nor the British public are for the deplorable use of chemical weapons in Syria, but with the Country still suffering from it's economic woes, I for one certainly don't wish to be dragged into another war with no clear exit plan. With costs of Storm Shadow missiles and submarine–launched Tomahawks costing £1.1million and £800,000 each (http://bit.ly/hkph3x). I feel this money is much better spent on offsetting the increased costs of war, even if the UK is not involved.
